snippet: Hassan Rouhani’s remarks were reported as being more harsh by the Iranian media, and Israel said Mr. Rouhani showed his “true face” with the comments.
abstract: Iran's president-elect Hassan Rouhani touches off international uproar with disputed comments about Israel, engendering a furious rejoinder from Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu; Rouhani's statements are said to have been translated incorrectly.

byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Hassan Rouhani’s remarks were reported as being more harsh by the Iranian media, and Israel said Mr. Rouhani showed his “true face” with the comments.

headline.main: Iran’s President-Elect Provokes Furor Abroad With Remarks on Israel
headline.print_headline: Iran’s President-Elect Provokes Furor Abroad With Remarks on Israel
